abstract: Family of Antonio Ciccarello is struggling to come to terms with fact that New York City Police Dept has opened homicide investigation into his recent death, which coroner found resulted from complications of stabbing he suffered in 1950s; case appears to be oldest of so-called reclassified homicides ever recorded in city, and while police have approached it as they would any other case, they have found no leads so far.
lead_paragraph: The New York City medical examiner determined that an operation after the stabbing in the 1950s led to Antonio Ciccarello’s death in September. The police have opened a murder investigation.
snippet: The New York City medical examiner determined that an operation after the stabbing in the 1950s led to Antonio Ciccarello’s death in September. The police have opened a murder investigation.

headline.main: A Twist in the Murder of a 97-Year-Old Man: He Was Knifed 5 Decades Ago
headline.print_headline: Twist in 97-Year-Old’s Murder: His Knifing Was 5 Decades Ago
